alert.note: Alert for Allamakee; Clayton (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 23 at 11:53PM CDT until July 24 at 12:45AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: The National Weather Service in La Crosse has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Clayton County in northeastern Iowa... Southeastern Allamakee County in northeastern Iowa... Western Crawford County in southwestern Wisconsin... * Until 1245 AM CDT. * At 1152 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Lansing to near Harpers Ferry to near Monona, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Clayton, southeastern Allamakee and western Crawford Counties, including the following locations... County Roads A 52 And X 52, Volney, Highway 35 And County D, Spook Cave Campground, Waterville, Eastman and Rush Creek. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
